author: Hilary Weaver
title: Tiffany Trump and Chelsea Clinton Had Very Different Fashion Week Expe | Vanity Fair

organizations.name: council of fashion designers of america

text:
Marla Maples and Tiffany Trump attend the Taoray Wang show at Skylight Clarkson Sq. in New York, February 11, 2017; Chelsea Clinton with designer, Tanya Taylor during New York Fashion Week, February 10, 2017. Left, by Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images; Right, by Samantha Nandez/BFA/Rex/Shutterstock. Update (February 14, 2017, 2:10 P.M.): Fashionista.com editor-in-chief Alyssa Vingan Klein tweeted Monday evening that seating at the New York Library Phillip Plein show was limited because no editors present wanted to sit next to Tiffany Trump . 
https://twitter.com/alyssavingan/status/831332726124994565 On Tuesday, Trump's friend Andrew Warren posted a photo of himself with Trump at the Phillip Plein show, with a note on the topic of that empty seat. “Me and my best #lastnight at @philippplein78 @philipppleininternational,” he wrote in his caption. “(ps. That seat was never empty it was reserved for [Plein’s] family).” The original article continues below. Former First Daughter Chelsea Clinton and current First Daughter Tiffany Trump are experiencing very different sides of New York Fashion Week. Clinton attended friend Tanya Taylor’s show on Friday, where the Daily Front Row reported that she slid in discreetly with her publicist and went largely unnoticed by the crowd. Meanwhile, Trump and her mother, Marla Maples, were joined by a full Secret Service detail when they attended a show for Chinese designer Taoray Wang, who designed Trump’s inauguration coat and dress, on Saturday, per Page Six. Trump told The Hollywood Reporter she would be attending a few more N.Y.F.W. events, although Page Six reported Thursday that she failed to make it into a party where a man with a “Fuck Trump” jacket demanded attention. Trump has been a presence at New York Fashion Week in the past, but not for sitting on the sidelines surrounded by heavy security. She "walked" in her friend Drew Warren’s show in February 2016, an event that made minor headlines while her father was making his way through the Republican primary. Clinton’s past involvement in Fashion Week has mostly been limited to fund-raisers for her mother’s campaign. In September 2016, she co-hosted the Made for History fashion show with Anna Wintour and Huma Abedin . But Clinton isn't leaving politics behind even with both of her parents out of office, tweeting her support for the Council of Fashion Designers of America's collaboration with Planned Parenthood. “I don’t think we have an option to stay calm these days,” she told the Daily at Taylor’s show. Tiffany Trump has not yet tweeted about Fashion Week. 1 / 16 Ivanka and Tiffany Trump’s Half-Sister Act A ringletted, towheaded, toddler Tiffany Trump drew both of her parents’ attention in New York City. Photo: By Catherine McGann/Getty Images. Ivanka with her father at the Plaza hotel, 1991. Photo: BY RON GALELLA/WIREIMAGE. Ivanka with Donald at a Beach Boys concert in Palm Beach, 1996. Photo: FROM DAVIDOFF STUDIOS/GETTY IMAGES. A six-year-old Tiffany Trump, with a cherry-red flamenco dress and gold fan, stood for a portrait at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach in 1999. Photo: by Davidoff Studios/Getty Images. Donald and Ivanka at a campaign rally in Manchester, New Hampshire, 2016. Photo: BY SUZANNE KREITER/THE BOSTON GLOBE/GETTY IMAGES. Ivanka Trump and Tiffany trade whispers across their sister-in-law, Lara, in the audience at the Republican National Convention this summer in Cleveland. Photo: Photograph by Justin Bishop. Tiffany Trump and Ivanka Trump outside the main doors of Donald Trump’s penthouse at Trump Tower, in Manhattan, 2014. Previous
